inra.ijpb.binary.distmap

Interface DistanceTransform

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Algo
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DistanceTransform3x3Float, DistanceTransform3x3Short, DistanceTransform5x5Float, DistanceTransform5x5Short

    public interface DistanceTransform
extends Algo
    Interface for computing distance maps from binary images.

    Example of use: 

    short[] shortWeights = ChamferWeights.CHESSKNIGHT.getShortWeights();
	boolean normalize = true;
	DistanceTransform dt = new DistanceTransform5x5Short(shortWeights, normalize);
	ImageProcessor result = dt.distanceMap(inputImage);
	// or:
	ImagePlus resultPlus = BinaryImages.distanceMap(imagePlus, shortWeights, normalize);
    See Also:
    BinaryImages.distanceMap(ImageProcessor, short[], boolean), BinaryImages.distanceMap(ImageProcessor, float[], boolean)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ij.process.ImageProcessor distanceMap(ij.process.ImageProcessor image)
      Computes the distance map from a binary image processor.

      • Methods inherited from interface inra.ijpb.algo.Algo

        addAlgoListener, removeAlgoListener

    • Method Detail

      • distanceMap

        ij.process.ImageProcessor distanceMap(ij.process.ImageProcessor image)
        Computes the distance map from a binary image processor. Distance is computed for each foreground (white) pixel, as the chamfer distance to the nearest background (black) pixel.
        Parameters:
        image - a binary image with white pixels (255) as foreground
        Returns:
        a new image containing:
        • 0 for each background pixel
        • the distance to the nearest background pixel otherwise
